overview.short: Cryptococcus laurentii is an environmental yeast occasionally implicated in opportunistic infection, typically less virulent than C. neoformans/gattii.
overview.clinical_context: Rarely isolated from clinical specimens; when involved, often in immunocompromised hosts or device-associated settings.

species_markers.notes: Encapsulation may be weak/variable compared with C. neoformans/gattii.
Weaker growth at 37째C vs pathogenic complexes can support non-neoformans species.
Inositol utilization may be less consistent than in neoformans/gattii.

common_confusions.reason: Both can be urease-positive yeasts; capsule and growth at 37째C are often more robust in C. neoformans.
Environmental yeasts can overlap; pigmentation differences may help but are not always reported.

when_to_question_identification: Strong capsule plus consistent 37째C growth may indicate C. neoformans/gattii instead.
Urease negativity suggests other yeast genera.
A strong sugar fermentation profile is inconsistent with Cryptococcus.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Best practical discriminator for non-neoformans Cryptococcus species.
Helps separate pathogenic complexes from more environmental species.
Useful if MALDI is inconclusive or to confirm unusual isolates.
